result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Michael Hartung

records.addlTxt:
9:35 AM Defendant Charles Michael Hartung appeared by video.  Attorney Rachel E. Pisors in court for Charles Michael Hartung.  Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advised has not received digital discovery, has offer and discussed with defendant but cannot accept without all discovery. STC set. Bond cont.
Status Conference scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status Conference on December 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant not to possess or consume a controlled substance without a valid prescription. Defendant not to possess drug paraphernalia. Defendant not to possess or consume alcohol and is not to enter bars or taverns, or any place where alcohol is sold or served for on-premises consumption. Defendant is to not have contact with any known drug users; defined as anyone with any drug related convictions in the last 5 years except in a therapeutic setting.

Attorney Pisors advised defendant waives reading of information and enters NG pleas. PTC/STC set. Defendant wishes to address bond, requests reduction. State objects, makes argument. Court denies modification. Bond to cont.

Def wishes to waive right to PH. Court advised def right to PH. Def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for further proceedings. Information filed. Atty Pisors states def waives reading of information and enters NG plea. PTC/STC set. Bond cont.

10:07 AM Defendant Charles Michael Hartung appeared by video, in custody from the TC Jail.  Attorney Rachel E. Pisors in court for Charles Michael Hartung.  Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant wishes to be in person. Court advised no statutory right to in-person appearance. Defense makes argument, plans to go through arraignment. Court advised then would have the right to be in person. 
10:14 AM Defendant Charles Michael Hartung appears in person, in custody from TC Jail. Attorney Rachel E. Pisors appears in court for Charles Michael Hartung. Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the state of Wisconsin. Court advised defendant of rights/max penalties. Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status Conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status Conference on October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Defendant not to possess or consume a controlled substance without a valid prescription. Defendant not to possess drug paraphernalia. Defendant not to possess or consume alcohol and is not to enter bars or taverns, or any place where alcohol is sold or served for on-premises consumption. Defendant is to not have contact with any known drug users; defined as anyone with any drug related convictions in the last 5 years except in a therapeutic setting.

3:25 PM Defendant Charles Michael Hartung appeared by video, in custody from TC Jail.  Attorney John Harrison Sacia appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. State requests cash bond. Defendant makes statement, requests signature bond. INIT set. CBS.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on September 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
